doc.field: New York City Immigrant Labor History Project
New York City Immigrant Labor History Project
New York City Immigrant Labor History Project Oral History Collection
New York City Immigrant Labor History Project Oral History Collection

This recording contains excerpts of different interviews regarding the concept of family. The volume and sound quality of the recording fluctuate between excerpts. These excerpts cover the relationships between parents and their children and among siblings. They cover topics relating to how immigration to the United States (US) affected the family unit including the struggle between Americanization and the desire to uphold tradition; the ways in which immigrants learned English; family rules; the differences in child rearing between generations; the sequence of immigration among family members; the influence of religion in the US; the impact of education on a family's quality of life; and the ideas that women were to work in the home and men were to work outside of the home to support their family.
See also: Fischetti, Maria; Hyman, Bella; Lewis, Ivan; and Torres, Tony.
